the first word is reticent reticent used
to describe a person who's reserved and
doesn't like to speak much or reveal
their true feelings if you or someone
you know prefers to keep their feelings
to themselves and is usually the quiet
one in big and rowdy groups where
everyone is talking over each other and
having a real banter then this

person so the next time you wish to
describe someone as rather quiet and
reserved replace quiet and reserved with
this word reticent he or she is a
reticent person here is an example
sentence he was extremely reticent and
said little when asked about his opinion
on the topic
the second word we have is loquacious
loquacious say it with me
loquacious this is the total opposite of
quiet and reserved a loquacious person
has the habit of talking a lot someone
who is excessively talkative sometimes
so much so that it can get on your
nerves so instead of describing such a
person as highly talkative next time use
the word loquacious to describe them
here's an example sentence of what you

over time as I got to know her it

word erudite means intelligent
especially having great academic

intelligent say a class topper you know
who always comes first and passes all
the exams with flying colors
the word to use for them is erudite take

sanguine just almost flows as poetry

she made the wrong decision of marrying

she should have really thought it

what is a gullible person a gullible

everybody is good let's have a look at a

he was too gullible to realize that it
was

stop being so gullible and you can also
